channel.title: Fighting In The War Room
channel.itunes:summary: Prolific film and culture critics Katey Rich, Matt Patches, Da7e Gonzales and David Ehrlich take on pop culture topics, film and TV reviews and interview very special guests in bi-weekly installments.
channel.itunes:author: Katey, Matt, Da7e and David
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Movies and Pop-Culture Podcast

item.title: 95 – Master of None, Though Ofttimes Better Than Master of One.
item.dc:creator: Da7e
item.description: This podcast is made up of Jacks and a Jill of all trades. This week, Katey, Patches, David and Da7e have hopped on the newest Netflix season-long show drop, Aziz Ansari’s Master of None. It turns out that the makes on this podcast like it a lot and Da7e and Katey share their pre-Parks and […]
item.content:encoded:
This podcast is made up of Jacks and a Jill of all trades.

This week, Katey, Patches, David and Da7e have hopped on the newest Netflix season-long show drop, Aziz Ansari’s Master of None. It turns out that the makes on this podcast like it a lot and Da7e and Katey share their pre-Parks and Rec Aziz connections. Then, it’s an anniversary year for Chris Columbus’ Home Alone which makes us all feel old and leads to Patches revealing how his name is on the Home Alone 2 poster (so he claims!). Finally,  in honor of the dark comedy Entertainment what’s the current state of cinema that’s uncomfortable to watch? Does it have a place? How long before Da7e mentions A Serbian Film?

Take a listen, embed and/or download below; for more from all of us on Twitter: follow the show (@FITWR), Katey (@kateyrich) Da7e (@Da7e),  Patches (@misterpatches), and David (@davidehrlich or @CriterionCorner).

Please subscribe on iTunes and KICK US A REVIEW if you like what you hear!

FORMAT

00:00 – Lightning Round: Coupling Cinema

01:09 –   Intro: Welcome To Episode 95!  Review!

08:13 –  Tidbit: Master of None

19:18 – Mini Segment: HAppy Anniversary Home Alone

27:33 –  Segment 3: Entertainment that’s hard to watch…like Entertainment

50:22 – Outro

Music:

Tidbit

Mini

Seg 3

Outro

item.title: Review – Spectre
item.dc:creator: Da7e
item.description: For Your Ears Only This week, David, Patches, and Katey renege their 00-status to go rogue and review Spectre, the 24th installment of the James Bond franchise. Did Sam Mendes license to kill it or should you expect it to die? Find out in our review, where we also answer your lightning round questions on […]
item.content:encoded:
For Your Ears Only

This week, David, Patches, and Katey renege their 00-status to go rogue and review Spectre, the 24th installment of the James Bond franchise. Did Sam Mendes license to kill it or should you expect it to die? Find out in our review, where we also answer your lightning round questions on what comic strip deserves a movie.

Take a listen, embed and/or download below; for more from all of us on Twitter: follow the show (@FITWR), Katey (@kateyrich), Patches (@misterpatches), and David (@davidehrlich or @CriterionCorner).

Please subscribe on iTunes and KICK US A REVIEW if you like what you hear! We read new reviews on the show!

Music

“Meat Hands” – Clickhole
“James Bond Theme” - BestOfAccordeon

item.title: Thought Bubble 31 – Face Merkin or Brown Fuzzy CumberPatch?
item.dc:creator: Da7e
item.description: A podcast about Comics Pop Culture! Hello FITWR listeners, Republic City Dispatch fanatics and Storm of Spoilers/Cast of Kings fantasy nerds, we’re back for more comics discussion! New comics enthusiast Joanna Robinson of Vanity Fair’s Hollywood and The Station Agents podcast is joined by a guy who just wants to know how Secret Wars […]
item.content:encoded:
A podcast about Comics Pop Culture!

Hello FITWR listeners, Republic City Dispatch fanatics and Storm of Spoilers/Cast of Kings fantasy nerds, we’re back for more comics discussion!

New comics enthusiast Joanna Robinson of Vanity Fair’s Hollywood and The Station Agents podcast is joined by a guy who just wants to know how Secret Wars ends already,  Da7e Gonzales of Geek.com and  Latino-Review.com

No matter your level of engagement, if you’re interested in comic books and their surrounding pop culture, this show’s for you!

THIS WEEK: Television season has kicked off and this year there are two females at the forefront. Both Da7e and Jo have seen some of Jessica Jones and the first two episodes of Supergirl so it’s time to judge the first wave of female superheroes tossed at us since Agent Carter. Then, besides some light Batman news that involves the Red Hood and some debate about the X-Franchise, it’s time to talk about Doctor Strange and Benedict Cumberbatch’s facial hair.

SUBMIT YOUR QUESTIONS for the next episode here in the comments, or e-mail us at bubbleyourthoughts@gmail.com

SUBSCRIBE TO US ON iTUNES AND LEAVE US A REVIEW!

Episode Links:

Jackman/X-Men Rumor

Solo Batman rumor

Joanna interviews the Flash father figures

This week’s closing track is “Superman” by Goldfinger

item.title: 94 – Is James Bond a franchise, an anthology or something else entirely?
item.dc:creator: Da7e
item.description: Plus: STAR TREK is coming back to sorta-TV This week, Katey, Patches, David and Da7e ponder the announcement from this Monday that CBS is launching a new Star Trek TV series that will air on broadcast television before all new episodes being banished to a CBS pay for VOD service. This week also saw the […]
item.content:encoded:
Plus: STAR TREK is coming back to sorta-TV

This week, Katey, Patches, David and Da7e ponder the announcement from this Monday that CBS is launching a new Star Trek TV series that will air on broadcast television before all new episodes being banished to a CBS pay for VOD service. This week also saw the conclusion of HBO’s Project Greenlight and the premiere of The Leisure Class leading Da7e and David to revisit their comments at the beginning of the series. Finally: the week we see SPECTRE the new James Bond movie which has us all wondering what makes the Bond franchise unique amongst all the film franchises of yesterday and today.

Take a listen, embed and/or download below; for more from all of us on Twitter: follow the show (@FITWR), Katey (@kateyrich) Da7e (@Da7e),  Patches (@misterpatches), and David (@davidehrlich or @CriterionCorner).

Please subscribe on iTunes and KICK US A REVIEW if you like what you hear!

FORMAT

00:00 – Lightning Round: *Adult Peanut Noises*

01:09 –   Intro: Welcome To Episode 94!  MANY REVIEWS!

08:13 –  Tidbit: Star Trek to CBS All Access

19:18 – Mini Segment: Project Greenlight Revisited 

27:33 –  Segment 3: James Bond: Franchise, anthology or something else entirely?

50:22 – Outro

Music:

Tidbit/Outro

Mini

Seg 3

item.title: 93 – Hello Hotline Bling
item.dc:creator: Da7e
item.description: Did Steve Jobs just bomb? This week, in honor of both Adele’s “Hello” and Drake’s “Hotline Bling,” Katey, David, Patches and Da7e unite to talk about music videos and their purpose in the new audio-visual landscape. Are they a gateway into the narrative film industry or more style over substance and how has this changed […]
item.content:encoded:
Did Steve Jobs just bomb?

This week, in honor of both Adele’s “Hello” and Drake’s “Hotline Bling,” Katey, David, Patches and Da7e unite to talk about music videos and their purpose in the new audio-visual landscape. Are they a gateway into the narrative film industry or more style over substance and how has this changed since the days of your David Fincher and Spike Jonzes? Also, the gang asks Da7e how he enjoyed the Goosebumps movie considering he read all 62 installments of the original series and David wants to talk about how/why/if Steve Jobs has failed at the box office. That, plus YOU can cast Sandra Bullock in something.

Take a listen, embed and/or download below; for more from all of us on Twitter: follow the show (@FITWR), Katey (@kateyrich) Da7e (@Da7e),  Patches (@misterpatches), and David (@davidehrlich or @CriterionCorner).

Please subscribe on iTunes and KICK US A REVIEW if you like what you hear!

FORMAT

00:00 – Lightning Round: Starring Sandra Bullock

01:24 –   Intro: Welcome To Episode 93!  PATCHES RISKS IT ALL!

03:15 –  Tidbit: Steve Jobs at the Box Office

15:01 – Mini Segment: Goosebumps

20:57 –  Segment 3: The modern music videos

43:48 – Outro

Music:

Tidbit

Mini

Seg 3

item.title: STORM OF SPOILERS – We Feel It, Bro
item.dc:creator: Da7e
item.category: A Song of Ice and Fire
item.description: A GAME OF THRONES PODCAST FOR PEOPLE WHO WANT TO TALK ABOUT SPOILERS With Joanna Robinson from Vanity Fair, Dave Gonzales from Geek.com and Neil Miller from Film School Rejects! If you’re looking for spoiler-free dissection of the highest caliber, or reading along with Season One of the HBO show, you’re looking for A CAST OF […]
item.content:encoded:
A GAME OF THRONES PODCAST FOR PEOPLE WHO WANT TO TALK ABOUT SPOILERS

With Joanna Robinson from Vanity Fair, Dave Gonzales from Geek.com and Neil Miller from Film School Rejects!

If you’re looking for spoiler-free dissection of the highest caliber, or reading along with Season One of the HBO show, you’re looking for A CAST OF KINGS (click there)

This podcast includes some occasional cursing, because sh*ts getting exciting.

SURPRISE! There have been enough new developments in the production of the upcoming Season Six that we thought we’d drop another podcast talking about it. The Blackfish are on the scene! We know where Jaime is going to pop up again and that poses questions about Sand Snakes from Da7e, we pin-point pretty much where Drogon is going to burn something down and — of course — we all know who has been seen alive and battling in the north.

Follow Neil (@rejects), Joanna (@jowrotethis) and Da7e (@da7e) on Twitter! 

Like this podcast? Subscribe to FIGHTING IN THE WAR ROOM through iTunes or your podcast app.

A Storm of Spoilers theme by schädel

This week’s closing track:

POST SCRIPT:

A photo posted by Kit Harington/Jon Snow/GoT (@wildling4kitharington) on Oct 6, 2015 at 1:30pm PDT

item.title: 92 – Catching Up Way Too Late
item.dc:creator: Da7e
item.description: And if there’s anything out there right now making the case for theater-going This week, Katey, David and Patches are down a Da7e, but still manage to bring the heat with a discussion about David’s mysterious dog-related tweet review of the Carrie Mulligan movie Suffragette, then Katey prompts everyone to recommend something they are catching […]
item.content:encoded:
And if there’s anything out there right now making the case for theater-going

This week, Katey, David and Patches are down a Da7e, but still manage to bring the heat with a discussion about David’s mysterious dog-related tweet review of the Carrie Mulligan movie Suffragette, then Katey prompts everyone to recommend something they are catching up late on because she finally discovered USA’s Playing House. Finally, The Walk and Everest are movies meant to be seen in the theater, but it doesn’t seem like people are. That plus The Martian‘s theatrical performance has Katey wondering if we go to theaters anymore.

Take a listen, embed and/or download below; for more from all of us on Twitter: follow the show (@FITWR), Katey (@kateyrich) Da7e (@Da7e),  Patches (@misterpatches), and David (@davidehrlich or @CriterionCorner).

Please subscribe on iTunes and KICK US A REVIEW if you like what you hear!

FORMAT

00:00 – Lightning Round: Eccentric Nonsense Franchises

01:11 –   Intro: Welcome To Episode 92!  REVIEWS!

04:13 –  Tidbit: Suffragette and David’s Unhappy Dog Review 

15:58 – Mini Segment: Catching Up on Things Way Late

23:05 –  Segment 3: The Walk, Everest, The Martian and Theater-going Spectacle

41:39 – Outro

Music:

Tidbit

Mini

Seg 3

item.title: Review – Crimson Peak
item.dc:creator: Da7e
item.description: A story with ghosts. This week, David, Katey, and Patches stay a night in the most haunted movie of the year: Crimson Peak. Can they survive the ghastly sights within? Yes. Yes they can. Because they also have to review Steven Spielberg’s Bridge of Spies and answer your Goosebumps-themed lightning round question answers. Take a […]
item.content:encoded:
A story with ghosts.

This week, David, Katey, and Patches stay a night in the most haunted movie of the year: Crimson Peak. Can they survive the ghastly sights within? Yes. Yes they can. Because they also have to review Steven Spielberg’s Bridge of Spies and answer your Goosebumps-themed lightning round question answers.

Take a listen, embed and/or download below; for more from all of us on Twitter: follow the show (@FITWR), Katey (@kateyrich), Patches (@misterpatches), and David (@davidehrlich or @CriterionCorner).

item.title: Review – Steve Jobs
